author: R Sujatha
text:
Heritage building is being used to store exam manuscripts

Professors of the University of Madras are worried about the fate of the 137-year-old Senate House, a remarkable example of Indo-Saracenic architecture.

At Saturday’s budget meeting, the building came up for discussion, with P.D. Balaji, head of the Department of Archaeology, expressing concern that the building did not possess a fire extinguisher and that it was being used to store exam manuscripts. Several other members also sought details of how the restoration fund was used.

Thangam Menon, chairperson of the meeting, said it was used for repair works ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit.

The ‘A’ category heritage structure was renovated and reopened in 2006. The proposal to hold Senate meetings was abandoned after members complained of poor acoustics.
title: Neglect of Senate House worries professors
